What is your preferred payment method?
Please indicate the study for which the candidate meets all inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Which describes this candidate’s current living situation?
If you chose “other living situation”, please describe:
If the individual requires assistance due to motor impairments, cognitive impairments, or both, check the main tasks for which the individual requires assistance (Check all that apply)
If you checked “other task assistance” above, please describe the assistance:
Does the individual have gross motor impairments?
Please describe any gross motor impairments
Does the individual have fine motor impairments?
Please describe any fine motor impairments
Is the individual able to walk for short periods without assistance during testing (even if preferring to use a cane or walker normally)?
If this candidate is being nominated for the Norm study, is the individual currently taking any of the medications on the medications exclusion list for norm sample cases?
Do you have any problems moving one or more parts of your body (arms, legs, fingers, hands, etc.)?
If yes, please explain briefly
Do you live in your own home without needing regular help with everyday tasks such as cooking, cleaning, and taking care of yourself?
Did you participate in any of the B-MAT (formerly BOT-2 Adult) pilot studies?
Do you have experience administering the current BOT-2 for children?
Approximately what percent of your professional time is spent with individuals age 40-70 years old?
Approximately what percent of your professional time is spent with individuals age older than 70 years old?
Which study samples do you have access to test for the B-MAT standardization? Select all that apply.
We may be able to find candidates for you. Examiners with their own access are preferred. Indicate the pool(s) of candidates you would be willing to test. (select both if applicable)

BMAT testing requires the use of a computer. Do you have a laptop or desktop you could use for testing? If it is a desktop, it must be in a location with at least 10X12 feet of space to complete the BMAT tasks.
What type of computer(s) do you have access to for use during the BMAT testing?
What operating system do your PC computer(s) run on?
If you chose Other Operating System for your PC (please specify)
What is the operating system for your MAC computer(s)?
If you chose Other Operating System for your Mac (please specify)

To participate you must have access to some additional testing materials not supplied by Pearson (tape measure, tape, 12 inch ruler, standard armless chair, 2-, 4, 5-, & 8-pound dumbbells, stair or exercise step, 7-8 inches in height). Please confirm whether or not you do have access.

A subset of the BMAT NORM/Independent Living subjects can be assigned to an Interscorer study if you know of another qualified examiner that could participate in the BMAT standardization. This examiner would sit in on a select number of your testing sessions and score as you are testing. Please select a response regarding this possibility for you.
If you said you could participate in the interscorer study, please identify your colleague who would work with you on that testing.

What language does the primary caregiver speak to the child?

Where does the child spend most of the day?
This child speaks Spanish in the classroom?
Was the child born prematurely?

Which best describes your child’s spoken language?

If the child speaks other languages or dialects, please specify.
If the child was born prematurely, please specify.
If "Other" was selected on where child spends most of day, please specify.
Is the child colorblind?
How long has the child lived in the U.S. in years?
How long has the child lived in the U.S. in months?
